intro: Neochilenia malleolata var. solitaria, commonly known as the solitary neochilenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. This variant is notable for its solitary growth habit and is often found in moist, rocky habitats.
